\chapter{Introduction}
\label{\detokenize{ref/ref_cpp:introduction}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
toulbar2 is an open\sphinxhyphen{}source C++ solver for cost function networks.

\sphinxAtStartPar
See : \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Class Diagram}}.


\chapter{Main types and constants}
\label{\detokenize{ref/ref_cpp:main-types-and-constants}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
The main types are:\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
::Value : domain value

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
::Cost : cost value (exact type depends on compilation flag)

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
::Long : large integer (long long int)

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
::TProb : probability value (exact type depends on compilation flag)

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
::TLogProb : log probability value (exact type depends on compilation flag)

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
::Double : large float (long double)

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
::tValue : a short Value type for tuples

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
::Tuple : vector of tValues to encode tuples

\end{itemize}


\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Note:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Compilation flag for Cost is: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{INT\_COST}} (int), \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LONGLONG\_COST}} (long long), or \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{PARETOPAIR\_COST}} (see ::ParetoPair) 
\end{sphinxadmonition}

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Note:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Compilation flag for TProb is: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{DOUBLE\_PROB}} or \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LONGDOUBLE\_PROB}} 
\end{sphinxadmonition}

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Note:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Compilation flag for T(Log)Prob is: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{DOUBLE\_PROB}} or \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LONGDOUBLE\_PROB}} 
\end{sphinxadmonition}

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{warning}{Warning:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{PARETOPAIR\_COST}} is fragile. 
\end{sphinxadmonition}

\chapter{WeightedCSP class}
\label{\detokenize{ref/ref_cpp:weightedcsp-class}}\index{WeightedCSP (C++ class)@\spxentry{WeightedCSP}\spxextra{C++ class}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{ref/ref_cpp:_CPPv411WeightedCSP}}\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{ref/ref_cpp:_CPPv311WeightedCSP}}\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{ref/ref_cpp:_CPPv211WeightedCSP}}\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{ref/ref_cpp:WeightedCSP}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysigstartmultiline
\pysigline{\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{ref/ref_cpp:classWeightedCSP}}\DUrole{k}{class}\DUrole{w}{  }\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{\DUrole{n}{WeightedCSP}}}}
\pysigstopmultiline
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Abstract class {\hyperref[\detokenize{ref/ref_cpp:classWeightedCSP}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{std,std-ref}{WeightedCSP}}}} representing a weighted constraint satisfaction problem\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
problem lower and upper bounds

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
list of variables with their finite domains (either represented by an enumerated list of values, or by a single interval)

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
list of cost functions (created before and during search by variable elimination of variables with small degree)

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
local consistency propagation (variable\sphinxhyphen{}based propagation) including cluster tree decomposition caching (separator\sphinxhyphen{}based cache)

\end{itemize}


\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Note:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Variables are referenced by their lexicographic index number (as returned by \sphinxstyleemphasis{eg} {\hyperref[\detokenize{ref/ref_cpp:classWeightedCSP_1a2329c94c60817153e45de627c79f8281}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{std,std-ref}{WeightedCSP::makeEnumeratedVariable}}}}) 
\end{sphinxadmonition}

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Note:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Cost functions are referenced by their lexicographic index number (as returned by \sphinxstyleemphasis{eg} WeightedCSP::postBinaryConstraint) 
\end{sphinxadmonition}

\sphinxAtStartPar

\end{sphinxadmonition}
\begin{quote}\begin{description}

\sphinxAtStartPar
the worst\sphinxhyphen{}case assignment finite cost 

\end{description}\end{quote}

updates infinite costs in all cost functions accordingly to the problem global lower and upper bounds 

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{warning}{Warning:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
to be used in preprocessing only 
\end{sphinxadmonition}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{WeightedCSP::sortConstraints (C++ function)@\spxentry{WeightedCSP::sortConstraints}\spxextra{C++ function}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{ref/ref_cpp:_CPPv4N11WeightedCSP15sortConstraintsEv}}\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{ref/ref_cpp:_CPPv3N11WeightedCSP15sortConstraintsEv}}\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{ref/ref_cpp:_CPPv2N11WeightedCSP15sortConstraintsEv}}\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{ref/ref_cpp:WeightedCSP::sortConstraints}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysigstartmultiline
\pysiglinewithargsret{\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{ref/ref_cpp:classWeightedCSP_1a31a9384d3dabf5388fe610710f2f19e0}}\DUrole{k}{virtual}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{kt}{void}\DUrole{w}{  }\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{\DUrole{n}{sortConstraints}}}}{}{\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{p}{=}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{m}{0}}
\pysigstopmultiline
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
sorts the list of cost functions associated to each variable based on smallest problem variable indexes 

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Note:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
must be called after creating all the cost functions and before solving the problem 
\end{sphinxadmonition}

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{warning}{Warning:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
side\sphinxhyphen{}effect: updates DAC order according to an existing variable elimination order 
\end{sphinxadmonition}

\end{fulllineitems}

\sphinxAtStartPar
post a soft or weighted regular cost function 

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{warning}{Warning:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Weights are ignored in the current implementation of DAG and flow\sphinxhyphen{}based propagators post a soft weighted regular cost function 
\end{sphinxadmonition}
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Parameters}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{scopeIndex}} \textendash{} an array of variable indexes as returned by {\hyperref[\detokenize{ref/ref_cpp:classWeightedCSP_1a2329c94c60817153e45de627c79f8281}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{std,std-ref}{WeightedCSP::makeEnumeratedVariable}}}} 

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{arity}} \textendash{} the size of the array 

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{semantics}} \textendash{} the semantics of the soft global cost function: “var” or “edit” (flow\sphinxhyphen{}based propagator) or \&\#8212; “var” (DAG\sphinxhyphen{}based propagator)\&\#8212; (unused parameter for network\sphinxhyphen{}based propagator) 

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{propagator}} \textendash{} the propagation method (“flow”, “DAG”, “network”) 

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{baseCost}} \textendash{} the scaling factor of the violation (“flow”, “DAG”) 

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{nbStates}} \textendash{} the number of the states in the corresponding DFA. The states are indexed as 0, 1, …, nbStates\sphinxhyphen{}1 

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{initial\_States}} \textendash{} a vector of WeightedObjInt specifying the starting states with weight 

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{accepting\_States}} \textendash{} a vector of WeightedObjInt specifying the final states 

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{Wtransitions}} \textendash{} a vector of (weighted) transitions 

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{scopeIndex}} \textendash{} an array of the first group of variable indexes as returned by {\hyperref[\detokenize{ref/ref_cpp:classWeightedCSP_1a2329c94c60817153e45de627c79f8281}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{std,std-ref}{WeightedCSP::makeEnumeratedVariable}}}} 

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{arity}} \textendash{} the size of \sphinxstyleemphasis{scopeIndex} 

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{semantics}} \textendash{} the semantics of the global cost function: “var” or “weight” 

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{propagator}} \textendash{} the propagation method (“DAG” only) 

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{baseCost}} \textendash{} the scaling factor of the violation 

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{nbSymbols}} \textendash{} the number of symbols in the corresponding grammar. Symbols are indexed as 0, 1, …, nbSymbols\sphinxhyphen{}1 

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{startSymbol}} \textendash{} the index of the starting symbol 

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{WRuleToTerminal}} \textendash{} a vector of \sphinxstyleemphasis{::CFGProductionRule}. Note that:\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
if \sphinxstyleemphasis{order} in \sphinxstyleemphasis{CFGProductionRule} is set to 0, it is classified as A \sphinxhyphen{}\textgreater{} v, where A is the index of the terminal symbol and v is the value.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
if \sphinxstyleemphasis{order} in \sphinxstyleemphasis{CFGProductionRule} is set to 1, it is classified as A \sphinxhyphen{}\textgreater{} BC, where A,B,C the index of the nonterminal symbols.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
if \sphinxstyleemphasis{order} in \sphinxstyleemphasis{CFGProductionRule} is set to 2, it is classified as weighted A \sphinxhyphen{}\textgreater{} v, where A is the index of the terminal symbol and v is the value.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
if \sphinxstyleemphasis{order} in \sphinxstyleemphasis{CFGProductionRule} is set to 3, it is classified as weighted A \sphinxhyphen{}\textgreater{} BC, where A,B,C the index of the nonterminal symbols.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
if \sphinxstyleemphasis{order} in \sphinxstyleemphasis{CFGProductionRule} is set to values greater than 3, it is ignored. 

\end{itemize}


\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\chapter{WeightedCSPSolver class}
\label{\detokenize{ref/ref_cpp:weightedcspsolver-class}}\index{WeightedCSPSolver (C++ class)@\spxentry{WeightedCSPSolver}\spxextra{C++ class}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{ref/ref_cpp:_CPPv417WeightedCSPSolver}}\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{ref/ref_cpp:_CPPv317WeightedCSPSolver}}\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{ref/ref_cpp:_CPPv217WeightedCSPSolver}}\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{ref/ref_cpp:WeightedCSPSolver}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysigstartmultiline
\pysigline{\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{ref/ref_cpp:classWeightedCSPSolver}}\DUrole{k}{class}\DUrole{w}{  }\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{\DUrole{n}{WeightedCSPSolver}}}}
\pysigstopmultiline
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Abstract class {\hyperref[\detokenize{ref/ref_cpp:classWeightedCSPSolver}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{std,std-ref}{WeightedCSPSolver}}}} representing a WCSP solver\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
link to a {\hyperref[\detokenize{ref/ref_cpp:classWeightedCSP}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{std,std-ref}{WeightedCSP}}}}

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
generic complete solving method configurable through global variables (see {\hyperref[\detokenize{ref/ref_cpp:classToulBar2}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{std,std-ref}{ToulBar2}}}} class and command line options)

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
optimal solution available after problem solving

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
elementary decision operations on domains of variables

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
statistics information (number of nodes and backtracks)

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
problem file format reader (multiple formats, see Weighted Constraint Satisfaction Problem file format (wcsp))

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
solution checker (output the cost of a given solution) 

\end{itemize}

\index{WeightedCSPSolver::narycsp (C++ function)@\spxentry{WeightedCSPSolver::narycsp}\spxextra{C++ function}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{ref/ref_cpp:_CPPv4N17WeightedCSPSolver7narycspE6stringR6vectorI5ValueE}}\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{ref/ref_cpp:_CPPv3N17WeightedCSPSolver7narycspE6stringR6vectorI5ValueE}}\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{ref/ref_cpp:_CPPv2N17WeightedCSPSolver7narycspE6stringR6vectorI5ValueE}}\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{ref/ref_cpp:WeightedCSPSolver::narycsp__string.vector:Value:R}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysigstartmultiline
\pysiglinewithargsret{\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{ref/ref_cpp:classWeightedCSPSolver_1af481cf37ff94238ab1e15bff34026209}}\DUrole{k}{virtual}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{n}{Cost}\DUrole{w}{  }\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{\DUrole{n}{narycsp}}}}{\DUrole{n}{string}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{n,sig-param}{cmd}, \DUrole{n}{vector}\DUrole{p}{\textless{}}\DUrole{n}{Value}\DUrole{p}{\textgreater{}}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{p}{\&}\DUrole{n,sig-param}{solution}}{\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{p}{=}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{m}{0}}
\pysigstopmultiline
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
solves the current problem using INCOP local search solver by Bertrand Neveu 

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Note:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
side\sphinxhyphen{}effects: updates current problem upper bound and propagates, best solution saved (using WCSP::setBestValue) 
\end{sphinxadmonition}

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{warning}{Warning:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
cannot solve problems with global cost functions 
\end{sphinxadmonition}
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Parameters}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{cmd}} \textendash{} command line argument for narycsp INCOP local search solver (cmd format: lowerbound randomseed nbiterations method nbmoves neighborhoodchoice neighborhoodchoice2 minnbneighbors maxnbneighbors neighborhoodchoice3 autotuning tracemode) 

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{solution}} \textendash{} best solution assignment found (MUST BE INITIALIZED WITH A DEFAULT COMPLETE ASSIGNMENT) 

\end{itemize}

\sphinxlineitem{Returns}
\sphinxAtStartPar
best solution cost found 

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{WeightedCSPSolver::solve\_symmax2sat (C++ function)@\spxentry{WeightedCSPSolver::solve\_symmax2sat}\spxextra{C++ function}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{ref/ref_cpp:_CPPv4N17WeightedCSPSolver16solve_symmax2satEiiPiPiPdPi}}\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{ref/ref_cpp:_CPPv3N17WeightedCSPSolver16solve_symmax2satEiiPiPiPdPi}}\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{ref/ref_cpp:_CPPv2N17WeightedCSPSolver16solve_symmax2satEiiPiPiPdPi}}\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{ref/ref_cpp:WeightedCSPSolver::solve_symmax2sat__i.i.iP.iP.doubleP.iP}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysigstartmultiline
\pysiglinewithargsret{\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{ref/ref_cpp:classWeightedCSPSolver_1a31d726d9fb516710a9e5dff408cf0f01}}\DUrole{k}{virtual}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{kt}{bool}\DUrole{w}{  }\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{\DUrole{n}{solve\_symmax2sat}}}}{\DUrole{kt}{int}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{n,sig-param}{n}, \DUrole{kt}{int}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{n,sig-param}{m}, \DUrole{kt}{int}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{p}{*}\DUrole{n,sig-param}{posx}, \DUrole{kt}{int}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{p}{*}\DUrole{n,sig-param}{posy}, \DUrole{kt}{double}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{p}{*}\DUrole{n,sig-param}{cost}, \DUrole{kt}{int}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{p}{*}\DUrole{n,sig-param}{sol}}{\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{p}{=}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{m}{0}}
\pysigstopmultiline
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
quadratic unconstrained pseudo\sphinxhyphen{}Boolean optimization Maximize \(h' \times W \times h\) where \(W\) is expressed by all its non\sphinxhyphen{}zero half squared matrix costs (can be positive or negative, with \(\forall i, posx[i] \leq posy[i]\)) 

\sphinxAtStartPar


\sphinxstrong{See also:}
\nopagebreak


\sphinxAtStartPar
::solvesymmax2sat\_ for Fortran call 




\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Note:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
costs for \(posx \neq posy\) are multiplied by 2 by this method 
\end{sphinxadmonition}

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Note:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
by convention: \(h = 1 \equiv x = 0\) and \(h = -1 \equiv x = 1\) 
\end{sphinxadmonition}

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{warning}{Warning:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
does not allow infinite costs (no forbidden assignments, unconstrained optimization) 
\end{sphinxadmonition}
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Returns}
\sphinxAtStartPar
true if at least one solution has been found (array \sphinxstyleemphasis{sol} being filled with the best solution) 

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\begin{fulllineitems}

\sphinxAtStartPar
in BTD, merges recursively leaf clusters with their fathers if separator size smaller than {\hyperref[\detokenize{ref/ref_cpp:classToulBar2_1ab55513fadc69465246279c08ae56a238}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{std,std-ref}{ToulBar2::elimDegree}}}}, else in VNS, merges clusters if the ratio of number of separator variables by number of cluster variables is above a given threshold (command line option \sphinxhyphen{}E and possibly \sphinxhyphen{}e)
